name: linode
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing linode cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`linode` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/linode/terraform-provider-linode).

apiVersion.description: An HTTP User-Agent Prefix to prepend in API requests.

maxRetryDelayMs.description: Maximum delay in milliseconds before retrying a request.

minRetryDelayMs.description: Minimum delay in milliseconds before retrying a request.

skipInstanceReadyPoll.description: Skip waiting for a linode_instance resource to be running.

token.description: The token that allows you access to your Linode account

uaPrefix.description: An HTTP User-Agent Prefix to prepend in API requests.

url.description: The HTTP(S) API address of the Linode API to use.

entityId.description: The ID of the underlying entity this device references (i.e. the Linode's ID).

id.description: The ID of the Firewall Device.

label.description: This Firewall's unique label.

addresses.description: A list of IP addresses, CIDR blocks, or `0.0.0.0/0` (to allow all) this rule applies to.

ports.description: A list of ports and/or port ranges (i.e. "443" or "80-90").

protocol.description: The network protocol this rule controls.

addresses.description: A list of IP addresses, CIDR blocks, or `0.0.0.0/0` (to allow all) this rule applies to.

ports.description: A list of ports and/or port ranges (i.e. "443" or "80-90").

protocol.description: The network protocol this rule controls.

devices.description: A list of `disk` or `volume` attachments for this `config`.  If the `boot_config_label` omits a `devices` block, the Linode will not be booted.

helpers.description: Helpers enabled when booting to this Linode Config.

kernel.description: - A Kernel ID to boot a Linode with. Default is based on image choice. Examples are `linode/latest-64bit`, `linode/grub2`, `linode/direct-disk`, etc. See all kernels [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/kernels). Note that this is a paginated API endpoint ([docs](https://developers.linode.com/api/v4/linode-kernels)).

label.description: The Config's label for display purposes.  Also used by `boot_config_label`.

memoryLimit.description: - Defaults to the total RAM of the Linode

rootDevice.description: - The root device to boot. The corresponding disk must be attached to a `device` slot.  Example: `"/dev/sda"`

runLevel.description: - Defines the state of your Linode after booting. Defaults to `"default"`.

virtMode.description: - Controls the virtualization mode. Defaults to `"paravirt"`.

sda.description: ... `sdh` - (Optional) The SDA-SDH slots, represent the Linux block device nodes for the first 8 disks attached to the Linode.  Each device must be suplied sequentially.  The device can be either a Disk or a Volume identified by `disk_label` or `volume_id`. Only one disk identifier is permitted per slot. Devices mapped from `sde` through `sdh` are unavailable in `"fullvirt"` `virt_mode`.

diskId.description: The Disk ID of the associated `disk_label`, if used.

diskLabel.description: The `label` of the `disk` to map to this `device` slot.

volumeId.description: The Volume ID to map to this `device` slot.

distro.description: Controls the behavior of the Linode Config's Distribution Helper setting.

modulesDep.description: Creates a modules dependency file for the Kernel you run.

network.description: Controls the behavior of the Linode Config's Network Helper setting, used to automatically configure additional IP addresses assigned to this instance.

updatedbDisabled.description: Disables updatedb cron job to avoid disk thrashing.

authorizedKeys.description: A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. Only accepted if `image` is provided. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_keys` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

authorizedUsers.description: A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the `root` user's `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` file automatically. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_users` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

filesystem.description: The Disk filesystem can be one of: `"raw"`, `"swap"`, `"ext3"`, `"ext4"`, or `"initrd"` which has a max size of 32mb and can be used in the config `initrd` (not currently supported in this provider).

id.description: The ID of the disk in the Linode API.

image.description: An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with private/. See /images for more information on the Images available for you to use. Examples are `linode/debian9`, `linode/fedora28`, `linode/ubuntu16.04lts`, `linode/arch`, and `private/12345`. See all images [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/kernels). *Changing `image` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

label.description: The Config's label for display purposes.  Also used by `boot_config_label`.

rootPass.description: The initial password for the `root` user account. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `root_pass` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.* *If omitted, a random password will be generated but will not be stored in state.*

size.description: The size of the Disk in MB.

stackscriptData.description: An object containing responses to any User Defined Fields present in the StackScript being deployed to this Linode. Only accepted if 'stackscript_id' is given. The required values depend on the StackScript being deployed.  *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `stackscript_data` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

stackscriptId.description: The StackScript to deploy to the newly created Linode. If provided, 'image' must also be provided, and must be an Image that is compatible with this StackScript. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `stackscript_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

count.description: The number of nodes in the Node Pool.

type.description: A Linode Type for all of the nodes in the Node Pool.

instanceId.description: The ID of the underlying Linode instance.

certificate.description: The Base64 encoded and PEM formatted SSL certificate.

privateKey.description: The private key associated with the TLS/SSL certificate.

bucketName.description: The unique label of the bucket to which the key will grant limited access.

cluster.description: The Object Storage cluster where a bucket to which the key is granting access is hosted.

permissions.description: This Limited Access Keyâ€™s permissions for the selected bucket. Can be one of `"read_write"` or `"read_only"`. *Changing `permissions` forces the creation of a new Object Storage Key.*.

label.description: The StackScript's label is for display purposes only.

ipv4Address.description: The IPv4 address of the Linode.

macAddress.description: The mac address of the Linode.

provider.description:
The provider type for the linode package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

token.description: The token that allows you access to your Linode account

axfrIps.description: The list of IPs that may perform a zone transfer for this Domain. This is potentially dangerous, and should be set to an empty list unless you intend to use it.

description.description: A description for this Domain. This is for display purposes only.

domain.description: The domain this Domain represents. These must be unique in our system; you cannot have two Domains representing the same domain.

expireSec.description: The amount of time in seconds that may pass before this Domain is no longer authoritative. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

group.description: The group this Domain belongs to. This is for display purposes only.

masterIps.description: The IP addresses representing the master DNS for this Domain.

refreshSec.description: The amount of time in seconds before this Domain should be refreshed. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

retrySec.description: The interval, in seconds, at which a failed refresh should be retried. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

soaEmail.description: Start of Authority email address. This is required for master Domains.

status.description: Used to control whether this Domain is currently being rendered (defaults to "active").

tags.description: A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

ttlSec.description: 'Time to Live' - the amount of time in seconds that this Domain's records may be cached by resolvers or other domain servers. type.description: If this Domain represents the authoritative source of information for the domain it describes, or if it is a read-only copy of a master (also called a slave).

domainId.description: The ID of the Domain to access.  *Changing `domain_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Domain Record.*.

name.description: The name of this Record. Setting this is invalid for `SRV` records as it is generated by the API. This field's actual usage depends on the type of record this represents. For A and AAAA records, this is the subdomain being associated with an IP address.

port.description: The port this Record points to.

priority.description: The priority of the target host. Lower values are preferred.

protocol.description: The protocol this Record's service communicates with. Only valid for SRV records.

recordType.description: The type of Record this is in the DNS system. For example, A records associate a domain name with an IPv4 address, and AAAA records associate a domain name with an IPv6 address. *Changing `record_type` forces the creation of a new Linode Domain Record.*.

service.description: The service this Record identified. Only valid for SRV records.

tag.description: The tag portion of a CAA record. It is invalid to set this on other record types.

target.description: The target for this Record. This field's actual usage depends on the type of record this represents. For A and AAAA records, this is the address the named Domain should resolve to.

ttlSec.description: 'Time to Live' - the amount of time in seconds that this Domain's records may be cached by resolvers or other domain servers. Valid values are 300, 3600, 7200, 14400, 28800, 57600, 86400, 172800, 345600, 604800, 1209600, and 2419200 - any other value will be rounded to the nearest valid value.

weight.description: The relative weight of this Record. Higher values are preferred.

devices.description: The devices associated with this firewall.

disabled.description: If `true`, the Firewall's rules are not enforced (defaults to `false`).

inbounds.description: A firewall rule that specifies what inbound network traffic is allowed.

label.description: This Firewall's unique label.

linodes.description: A list of IDs of Linodes this Firewall should govern it's network traffic for.

outbounds.description: A firewall rule that specifies what outbound network traffic is allowed.

tags.description: A list of tags applied to the Kubernetes cluster. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

createdBy.description: The name of the User who created this Image.

deprecated.description: Whether or not this Image is deprecated. Will only be True for deprecated public Images.

description.description: A detailed description of this Image.

diskId.description: The ID of the Linode Disk that this Image will be created from.

expiry.description: Only Images created automatically (from a deleted Linode; type=automatic) will expire.

isPublic.description: True if the Image is public.

label.description: A short description of the Image. Labels cannot contain special characters.

linodeId.description: The ID of the Linode that this Image will be created from.

size.description: The minimum size this Image needs to deploy. Size is in MB.

type.description:
How the Image was created. 'Manual' Images can be created at any time. 'Automatic' images are created automatically from
a deleted Linode.

vendor.description: The upstream distribution vendor. Nil for private Images.

description.description: A detailed description of this Image.

diskId.description: The ID of the Linode Disk that this Image will be created from.

label.description: A short description of the Image. Labels cannot contain special characters.

linodeId.description: The ID of the Linode that this Image will be created from.

description.description: A detailed description of this Image.

diskId.description: The ID of the Linode Disk that this Image will be created from.

expiry.description: Only Images created automatically (from a deleted Linode; type=automatic) will expire.

isPublic.description: True if the Image is public.

label.description: A short description of the Image. Labels cannot contain special characters.

linodeId.description: The ID of the Linode that this Image will be created from.

size.description: The minimum size this Image needs to deploy. Size is in MB.

type.description:
How the Image was created. 'Manual' Images can be created at any time. 'Automatic' images are created automatically from
a deleted Linode.

vendor.description: The upstream distribution vendor. Nil for private Images.

authorizedKeys.description: A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. Only accepted if `image` is provided. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_keys` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

authorizedUsers.description: A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the `root` user's `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` file automatically. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_users` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

backupId.description: A Backup ID from another Linode's available backups. Your User must have read_write access to that Linode, the Backup must have a status of successful, and the Linode must be deployed to the same region as the Backup. See /linode/instances/{linodeId}/backups for a Linode's available backups. This field and the image field are mutually exclusive. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `backup_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

backups.description: Information about this Linode's backups status.

backupsEnabled.description: If this field is set to true, the created Linode will automatically be enrolled in the Linode Backup service. This will incur an additional charge. The cost for the Backup service is dependent on the Type of Linode deployed.

bootConfigLabel.description: The Label of the Instance Config that should be used to boot the Linode instance.  If there is only one `config`, the `label` of that `config` will be used as the `boot_config_label`. *This value can not be imported.*

configs.description: Configuration profiles define the VM settings and boot behavior of the Linode Instance.

group.description: The display group of the Linode instance.

image.description: An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with private/. See /images for more information on the Images available for you to use. Examples are `linode/debian9`, `linode/fedora28`, `linode/ubuntu16.04lts`, `linode/arch`, and `private/12345`. See all images [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/kernels). *Changing `image` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

ipAddress.description:
This Linode's Public IPv4 Address. If there are multiple public IPv4 addresses on this Instance, an arbitrary address
will be used for this field.

ipv4s.description:
This Linode's IPv4 Addresses. Each Linode is assigned a single public IPv4 address upon creation, and may get a single
private IPv4 address if needed. You may need to open a support ticket to get additional IPv4 addresses.

ipv6.description: This Linode's IPv6 SLAAC addresses. This address is specific to a Linode, and may not be shared.

label.description: The Config's label for display purposes.  Also used by `boot_config_label`.

privateIp.description: If true, the created Linode will have private networking enabled, allowing use of the 192.168.128.0/17 network within the Linode's region. It can be enabled on an existing Linode but it can't be disabled.

privateIpAddress.description:
This Linode's Private IPv4 Address. The regional private IP address range is 192.168.128/17 address shared by all Linode
Instances in a region.

region.description: This is the location where the Linode is deployed. Examples are `"us-east"`, `"us-west"`, `"ap-south"`, etc. See all regions [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/regions). *Changing `region` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*.

rootPass.description: The initial password for the `root` user account. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `root_pass` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.* *If omitted, a random password will be generated but will not be stored in state.*

stackscriptData.description: An object containing responses to any User Defined Fields present in the StackScript being deployed to this Linode. Only accepted if 'stackscript_id' is given. The required values depend on the StackScript being deployed.  *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `stackscript_data` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

stackscriptId.description: The StackScript to deploy to the newly created Linode. If provided, 'image' must also be provided, and must be an Image that is compatible with this StackScript. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `stackscript_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

status.description: The status of the instance, indicating the current readiness state.

swapSize.description: When deploying from an Image, this field is optional with a Linode API default of 512mb, otherwise it is ignored. This is used to set the swap disk size for the newly-created Linode.

tags.description: A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

type.description: The Linode type defines the pricing, CPU, disk, and RAM specs of the instance. Examples are `"g6-nanode-1"`, `"g6-standard-2"`, `"g6-highmem-16"`, `"g6-dedicated-16"`, etc. See all types [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/types).

watchdogEnabled.description: The watchdog, named Lassie, is a Shutdown Watchdog that monitors your Linode and will reboot it if it powers off unexpectedly. It works by issuing a boot job when your Linode powers off without a shutdown job being responsible. To prevent a loop, Lassie will give up if there have been more than 5 boot jobs issued within 15 minutes.

authorizedKeys.description: A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. Only accepted if `image` is provided. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_keys` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

authorizedUsers.description: A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the `root` user's `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` file automatically. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_users` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

backupId.description: A Backup ID from another Linode's available backups. Your User must have read_write access to that Linode, the Backup must have a status of successful, and the Linode must be deployed to the same region as the Backup. See /linode/instances/{linodeId}/backups for a Linode's available backups. This field and the image field are mutually exclusive. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `backup_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

backupsEnabled.description: If this field is set to true, the created Linode will automatically be enrolled in the Linode Backup service. This will incur an additional charge. The cost for the Backup service is dependent on the Type of Linode deployed.

bootConfigLabel.description: The Label of the Instance Config that should be used to boot the Linode instance.  If there is only one `config`, the `label` of that `config` will be used as the `boot_config_label`. *This value can not be imported.*

configs.description: Configuration profiles define the VM settings and boot behavior of the Linode Instance.

group.description: The display group of the Linode instance.

image.description: An Image ID to deploy the Disk from. Official Linode Images start with linode/, while your Images start with private/. See /images for more information on the Images available for you to use. Examples are `linode/debian9`, `linode/fedora28`, `linode/ubuntu16.04lts`, `linode/arch`, and `private/12345`. See all images [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/kernels). *Changing `image` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

label.description: The Config's label for display purposes.  Also used by `boot_config_label`.

privateIp.description: If true, the created Linode will have private networking enabled, allowing use of the 192.168.128.0/17 network within the Linode's region. It can be enabled on an existing Linode but it can't be disabled.

region.description: This is the location where the Linode is deployed. Examples are `"us-east"`, `"us-west"`, `"ap-south"`, etc. See all regions [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/regions). *Changing `region` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*.

rootPass.description: The initial password for the `root` user account. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `root_pass` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.* *If omitted, a random password will be generated but will not be stored in state.*

stackscriptData.description: An object containing responses to any User Defined Fields present in the StackScript being deployed to this Linode. Only accepted if 'stackscript_id' is given. The required values depend on the StackScript being deployed.  *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `stackscript_data` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

stackscriptId.description: The StackScript to deploy to the newly created Linode. If provided, 'image' must also be provided, and must be an Image that is compatible with this StackScript. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `stackscript_id` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

swapSize.description: When deploying from an Image, this field is optional with a Linode API default of 512mb, otherwise it is ignored. This is used to set the swap disk size for the newly-created Linode.

tags.description: A list of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

type.description: The Linode type defines the pricing, CPU, disk, and RAM specs of the instance. Examples are `"g6-nanode-1"`, `"g6-standard-2"`, `"g6-highmem-16"`, `"g6-dedicated-16"`, etc. See all types [here](https://api.linode.com/v4/linode/types).

watchdogEnabled.description: The watchdog, named Lassie, is a Shutdown Watchdog that monitors your Linode and will reboot it if it powers off unexpectedly. It works by issuing a boot job when your Linode powers off without a shutdown job being responsible. To prevent a loop, Lassie will give up if there have been more than 5 boot jobs issued within 15 minutes.

authorizedKeys.description: A list of SSH public keys to deploy for the root user on the newly created Linode. Only accepted if `image` is provided. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_keys` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

authorizedUsers.description: A list of Linode usernames. If the usernames have associated SSH keys, the keys will be appended to the `root` user's `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` file automatically. *This value can not be imported.* *Changing `authorized_users` forces the creation of a new Linode Instance.*

algorithm.description: What algorithm this NodeBalancer should use for routing traffic to backends: roundrobin, leastconn, source

check.description: The type of check to perform against backends to ensure they are serving requests. This is used to determine if backends are up or down. If none no check is performed. connection requires only a connection to the backend to succeed. http and http_body rely on the backend serving HTTP, and that the response returned matches what is expected.

checkAttempts.description: How many times to attempt a check before considering a backend to be down. (1-30)

checkBody.description:
This value must be present in the response body of the check in order for it to pass. If this value is not present in
the response body of a check request, the backend is considered to be down

checkInterval.description: How often, in seconds, to check that backends are up and serving requests.

checkPassive.description: If true, any response from this backend with a 5xx status code will be enough for it to be considered unhealthy and taken out of rotation.

checkPath.description: The URL path to check on each backend. If the backend does not respond to this request it is considered to be down.

checkTimeout.description: How long, in seconds, to wait for a check attempt before considering it failed. (1-30)

cipherSuite.description: What ciphers to use for SSL connections served by this NodeBalancer. `legacy` is considered insecure and should only be used if necessary.

nodebalancerId.description: The ID of the NodeBalancer to access.

port.description: The TCP port this Config is for. These values must be unique across configs on a single NodeBalancer (you can't have two configs for port 80, for example). While some ports imply some protocols, no enforcement is done and you may configure your NodeBalancer however is useful to you. For example, while port 443 is generally used for HTTPS, you do not need SSL configured to have a NodeBalancer listening on port 443. (Defaults to 80)

protocol.description: The protocol this port is configured to serve. If this is set to https you must include an ssl_cert and an ssl_key. (Defaults to "http")

proxyProtocol.description: The version of ProxyProtocol to use for the underlying NodeBalancer. This requires protocol to be `tcp`. Valid values are `none`, `v1`, and `v2`. (Defaults to `none`)

sslCert.description: The certificate this port is serving. This is not returned. If set, this field will come back as `<REDACTED>`. Please use the ssl_commonname and ssl_fingerprint to identify the certificate.

sslCommonname.description: The common name for the SSL certification this port is serving if this port is not configured to use SSL.

sslFingerprint.description: The fingerprint for the SSL certification this port is serving if this port is not configured to use SSL.

sslKey.description: The private key corresponding to this port's certificate. This is not returned. If set, this field will come back as `<REDACTED>`. Please use the ssl_commonname and ssl_fingerprint to identify the certificate.

stickiness.description: Controls how session stickiness is handled on this port: 'none', 'table', 'http_cookie'

contentBase64.description: Base64-encoded data that will be decoded and uploaded as raw bytes for the object content. This allows safely uploading non-UTF8 binary data, but is recommended only for small content such as the result of the `gzipbase64` function with small text strings. For larger objects, use `source` to stream the content from a disk file.

contentDisposition.description: Specifies presentational information for the object. Read [w3c content_disposition](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec19.html#sec19.5.1) for further information.

contentEncoding.description: Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field. Read [w3c content encoding](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.11) for further information.

contentLanguage.description: The language the content is in e.g. en-US or en-GB.

contentType.description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data, e.g. application/octet-stream. All Valid MIME Types are valid for this input.

forceDestroy.description: Allow the object to be deleted regardless of any legal hold or object lock (defaults to `false`).

key.description: They name of the object once it is in the bucket.

metadata.description: A map of keys/values to provision metadata.

secretKey.description: The secret key to authenitcate with.

source.description: The path to a file that will be read and uploaded as raw bytes for the object content. The path must either be relative to the root module or absolute.

versionId.description: A unique version ID value for the object.

websiteRedirect.description: Specifies a target URL for website redirect.

linode:index/rdns:Rdns.description:
Provides a Linode RDNS resource.  This can be used to create and modify RDNS records.

Linode RDNS names must have a matching address value in an A or AAAA record.  This A or AAAA name must be resolvable at the time the RDNS resource is being associated.

For more information, see the [Linode APIv4 docs](https://developers.linode.com/api/v4/networking-ips-address/#put) and the [Configure your Linode for Reverse DNS](https://www.linode.com/docs/networking/dns/configure-your-linode-for-reverse-dns-classic-manager/) guide.


## Import

Linodes RDNS resources can be imported using the address as the `id`.

```sh
 $ pulumi import linode:index/rdns:Rdns foo 123.123.123.123
```
